creator: insignia96
title: Make a lamp from a Monster Can
materials_required: 5/16" short (1 inch or less) bolt washer and nut
3 lb package of flat glass beads
description: The project aims to create a cool looking and functional lamp using a large aluminum can, preferably a Monster BFC. It incorporates a touch lamp controller for added functionality.
steps: Drill a 3" hole in scrap wood and save the plug. Drill a 17/32" hole in the plug.
Thread the nipple through the hole in the plug and attach the small piece between the bottom of the socket and the nipple.
Thread the little threaded tube into the bottom of the socket and assemble the parts, excluding the bulb socket and cover.

Wire the lamp. If using a touch controller, follow the instructions to connect the hot wire to the lamp and controller, one wire from the controller to the lamp, and the neutral wire to the controller. A fourth wire serves as the touch sensor.

If using a touch controller: Drill a 5/16 inch hole in the bottom center of the can. Tape together the bolt, loop from the touch controller, and the washer. Use a socket wrench with extenders to push the bolt through the hole, thread the nut, and tighten it.
Pour as many glass beads as possible into the can to weigh it down.
Push the long part of the nipple down into the beads, shaking the can carefully until the plug is flush with the surface.
